thread.title: Audi partners with Mount Hotham to create the new ‘home of Quattro’
thread.title_full: Audi partners with Mount Hotham to create the new ‘home of Quattro’

author: Alison Stephenson
title: Audi partners with Mount Hotham to create the new ‘home of Quattro’
text:
AS testament to their increasing market share in the luxury car market, Audi have added yet another partnership to their portfolio, signing on as a major sponsor of Mount Hotham.
As the fastest-growing premium car brand of the last 10 years, Audi has become known for their brand experiences across lifestyle, motoring and sport.
And this week saw the launch of the first ever Audi Quattro snow driving experience, which gave the public and Audi enthusiasts the chance to get behind the wheel of the all new Q7 SUV on a specially designed course in the Victorian ski region.
Lucky punters were flown from Sydney and Melbourne via private charter to Mt Hotham before embarking on a half-day driving experience led by Top Gear Australia alumni and chief driving instructor Steve Pizzati, followed by three course lunch and a chance to hit the slopes. This year’s event marks the first time the experience has been offered Down Under. Source: Supplied
Pizzati said the opportunity to drive on snow and ice gave the customer invaluable driving experience.
“It’s an opportunity for customers to not only sample the new Q7, but also to gain some important insight into how to drive in the often difficult conditions encountered in these alpine regions,” he said.
“It’s a fact that once you get your licence in Australia you’re allowed to drive anywhere, and yet driving on snow or in icy conditions presents unique problems that require a special approach.”
The Audi Q7 snow driving experience runs until the 8th September.
